figurative_meaning: Everyone should take responsibility for their actions.
example: In this project, κάθε κατεργάρης στον πάγκο του; we all have our roles to play.

idiom: Μην βάζεις όλα τα αυγά σε ένα καλάθι
literal_meaning: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
figurative_meaning: Don't risk everything on a single venture.
example: It's wise to diversify your investments; μην βάζεις όλα τα αυγά σε ένα καλάθι.
You think that plan will work? Πετάει ο γάιδαρος?

figurative_meaning: A quick and often unfair gain.
example: That deal was just an αρπαχτή; it wasn't fair for everyone involved.

idiom: Όποιος δεν έχει μυαλό έχει πόδια
literal_meaning: Whoever has no brain has legs.
figurative_meaning: If you don't think ahead, you'll have to run around fixing things.
example: You should plan better; όποιος δεν έχει μυαλό έχει πόδια.
Be careful what you say; η γλώσσα κόκαλα δεν έχει.
His plans are στον αέρα right now; nothing is confirmed.

figurative_meaning: To pretend not to understand or know.
example: He always κάνει το κορόιδο when asked about his mistakes.
When he started acting strange, I thought: πετάει η μύγα?

idiom: Μάτια που δεν βλέπονται, γρήγορα λησμονιούνται
literal_meaning: Eyes that do not see quickly forgotten.
figurative_meaning: When people are not present, they are easily forgotten.
example: When she moved away, I realized μάτια που δεν βλέπονται, γρήγορα λησμονιούνται.
